greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n such that the least part occurs exactly four times.
comment: Number of partitions p of n such that 3*min(p) + (number of parts of p) is a part of p. - _Clark Kimberling_, Feb 28 2014
formula: G.f.: Sum_{m>0} (x^(4*m) / Product_{i>m} (1-x^i)). More generally, g.f. for number of partitions of n such that the least part occurs exactly k times is Sum_{m>0} (x^(k*m) / Product_{i>m} (1-x^i)). _Vladeta Jovovic_
mathematica: a[n_] := Module[{p = IntegerPartitions[n], l = PartitionsP[n], c = 0, k = 1}, While[k < l + 1, q = PadLeft[ p[[k]], 5]; If[ q[[1]] != q[[5]] && q[[2]] == q[[5]], c++ ]; k++ ]; c]; Table[ a[n], {n, 53}]
Table[Count[IntegerPartitions[n], p_ /; MemberQ[p, Length[p] + 3*Min[p]]], {n, 50}] (* _Clark Kimberling_, Feb 28 2014 *)
results.author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jul 24 2004
